channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Envoy Holds 2nd Day of Talks on Cease-Fire in Lebanon
item.description: Amos Hochstein, a top Biden administration envoy to the Middle East, has seldom stayed overnight on trips to Beirut over the past year, so the extende...

item.title: As Trump Pushes Peace, Russia Intensifies Assaults on Ukraine
item.description: Overextended and exhausted, Ukrainian forces lack manpower and artillery against Russian forces willing to absorb staggering casualties.

item.title: U.S. Closes Its Kyiv Embassy, Warning of ‘Significant Air Attack’
item.description: The unusual alert came a day after Ukraine used American-made ballistic missiles to strike Russian territory for the first time.

item.title: Exclusive: Oishii, vertical farming startup, closes its Series B at $150 million
item.description: Vertical farming startup Oishii has closed its Series B at $150 million, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: Comcast to spin off NBCU cable TV channels
item.description: The new $7 billion company would reportedly include MSNBC, CNBC, Oxygen, E!, USA Network, Syfy, and Golf Channel.

item.title: Elon Musk wants to meet Alex Soros to ‘understand his goals’ after comparing his billionaire dad George to an X-Men villain
item.description: Alex Soros replied: "I often learn most from people whose views are different than my own. Open to meeting."

item.title: Middle East Airlines Has Become an Unlikely National Hero in Lebanon
item.description: Middle East Airlines has managed to fly through regional and civil wars since the 1960s. And it is still in the skies today.

item.title: Former W.W.E. Boss Tapped to Run Education, and Trans Rights on Capitol Hill
item.description: Plus, this musical wants France to love it back.

item.title: Employees are spending the equivalent of a month’s grocery bill on the return to the office–and growing more resentful than ever, survey finds
item.description: The average employee returning to the office spends $561 per month–that's the average two-person household’s grocery bill in the U.S. for the entire m...

item.title: As Trump Pushes Peace, Russia Intensifies Assaults on Ukraine
item.description: Overextended and exhausted, Ukrainian forces lack manpower and artillery against Russian forces willing to absorb staggering casualties.

item.title: Here’s how escalating Russia tensions could impact markets and supply chains, according to experts
item.description: The conflict could affect natural resources used in the production of semiconductors.

item.title: The Final Push for Ukraine?
item.description: We explore recent events in the war — and what could come next.

item.description: The unusual alert came a day after Ukraine used American-made ballistic missiles to strike Russian territory for the first time.

item.title: Out of Gaza
item.description: We photographed badly wounded Gazans who made it out for treatment. Many can think of little but the dead they left behind. “We wanted to go with them...
